name: src/CommandParser.js
CommandParser
description: Command parser used for looking up commands in the xml definition

name: constructor
description: CommandParser constructor

name: _getJson
description: Get an xml file and convert it to json

name: getCommand
description: Get a command based on it's path in the xml definition
examples:
const parser = new CommandParser();
const backFlip = parser.getCommand('minidrone', 'Animations', 'Flip', {direction: 'back'});

name: _getCommandFromBuffer
description: Gets the command by analysing the buffer

name: parseBuffer
description:
Parse the input buffer and get the correct command with parameters
Used internally to parse sensor data

params.name: buffer
params.description: The command buffer without the first two bytes

name: warmup
description: Warn up the parser by pre-fetching the xml files

params.name: files
params.description: List of files to load in defaults to {@link CommandParser._files}

name: _files
description: Mapping of known xml files

name: _assertElementExists
description: helper method

name: _getXml
description: Reads xml file from ArSDK synchronously without a cache

name: _arsdkXmlPath
description: Path of the ArSDK xml directory

name: src/DroneCommand.js

types: {"ACK": string, "DATA": string, "NON_ACK": string, "HIGH_PRIO": string, "LOW_LATENCY_DATA": string, "DATA_WITH_ACK": string}

name: DroneCommand
description:
Drone command

Used for building commands to be sent to the drone. It
is also used for the sensor readings.

Arguments are automatically mapped on the object. This
means that it is easy to set command arguments. Default
arguments values are 0 or their enum equivalent by default.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new DroneCommand instance

params.name: project
params.description: Project node from the xml spec

params.name: class_
params.description: Class node from the xml spec

params.name: command
params.description: Command node from the xml spec

name: projectId
description: The project id

name: projectName
description: The project name (minidrone, common, etc)

name: classId
description: The class id

name: className
description: The class name

name: commandId
description: The command id

name: commandName
description: The command name

name: arguments
description: Array containing the drone arguments

name: hasArguments
description: Returns if the command has any arguments

name: argumentNames
description: Get the argument names. These names are also mapped to the instance

name: description
description: Get the command description

name: deprecated
description: Get if the command has been deprecated

name: sendCharacteristicUuid
description: Get the send characteristic uuid based on the buffer type

name: hasArgument
description: Checks if the command has a certain argument

name: clone
description: Clones the instance

name: toBuffer
description: Converts the command to it's buffer representation
todo: don't fill in message id but use the first byte of the buffer to look up the current step in the connection handler

name: _mapArguments
description: Maps the arguments to the class

name: toString
description: Returns a string representation of a DroneCommand
examples:
const str = command.toString();

str === 'minidrone PilotingSettingsState PreferredPilotingModeChanged mode="medium"(1)';

params.name: debug
params.description: If extra debug information should be shown

name: bufferType
description: Get the command buffer type

name: bufferFlag
description: Get the command buffer flag based on it's type

name: getToken
description:
Get the token representation of the command. This
is useful for registering sensors for example

name: constructor
description: Command argument constructor

params.name: raw
params.description: Raw command argument data from the xml specification

name: name
description: Parameter name

name: description
description: Parameter description

name: type
description: Parameter type

name: value
description: Get the parameter value

name: value
description: Set the parameter value

name: hasEnumProperty
description: If it has the enum property set

name: _parseValue
description: Parses the value before setting it

name: getValueSize
description: Gets the byte size of the value.

name: toString
description: Returns a string representation of the DroneCommandArgument instance

params.name: debug
params.description: If extra debug info should be shown.

params.name: precision
params.description: Amount of precision for numerical values

name: DroneConnection
description:
Drone connection class

Exposes an api for controlling the drone

description: Creates a new DroneConnection instance

params.name: droneFilter

description: Event handler for when noble broadcasts a state change

description:
Event handler for when noble discovers a peripheral
Validates it is a drone and attempts to connect.

return.description: If the peripheral is a drone

name: _setupPeripheral
description: Sets up a peripheral and finds all of it's services and characteristics

description: Finds a Noble Characteristic class for the given characteristic UUID

return.description: The Noble Characteristic corresponding to that UUID

name: runCommand

description: Get the most recent sensor reading

unknown.tagValue: {DroneCommand|undefined} - {@link DroneCommand} instance or {@link undefined} if no sensor reading could be found

return.description: {@link DroneCommand} instance or {@link undefined} if no sensor reading could be found

name: getSensorFromToken
description: Get the most recent sensor reading using the sensor token

unknown.tagValue: {DroneCommand|undefined} - {@link DroneCommand} instance or {@link undefined} if no sensor reading could be found

return.description: {@link DroneCommand} instance or {@link undefined} if no sensor reading could be found

content:
Minidrone-js [![](https://badge.fury.io/js/minidrone-js.svg)](https://badge.fury.io/js/minidrone-js) [![](https://api.codeclimate.com/v1/badges/fc937ad532e4160ea2f0/maintainability)](https://codeclimate.com/github/Mechazawa/minidrone-js/maintainability)
---------------

Minidrone-js is an easy to use drone library for the Parrot 
Minidrones. In theory it supports many different Parrot drones 
besides Minidrones but this is untested. 

This library is loosely based on the work by [fetherston] for 
[npm-parrot-minidrone] and [amymcgovern] for [pymambo].

[amymcgovern]: https://github.com/amymcgovern
[pymambo]: https://github.com/amymcgovern/pymambo
[fetherston]: https://github.com/fetherston
[npm-parrot-minidrone]: https://github.com/fetherston/npm-parrot-minidrone

## Functionality
This library is designed to support the two-way command communication 
protocol used by Parrot drones. It supports receiving sensor updates 
and sending commands based on the [xml specification]. 

[xml specification]: https://github.com/Parrot-Developers/arsdk-xml/blob/master/xml/

## Installation

Using yarn

```bash
yarn add minidrone-js
```

or using npm

```bash
npm install minidrone-js
```

## Example

This example will make the drone take-off, do a flip and then land again.

```js
const {DroneConnection, CommandParser} = require('minidrone-js');

const parser = new CommandParser();
const drone = new DroneConnection();


/* 
 * Commands are easily found by reading the xml specification
 * https://github.com/Parrot-Developers/arsdk-xml/blob/master/xml/
 */
const takeoff = parser.getCommand('minidrone', 'Piloting', 'TakeOff');
const landing = parser.getCommand('minidrone', 'Piloting', 'Landing');
const backFlip = parser.getCommand('minidrone', 'Animations', 'Flip', {direction: 'back'});



drone.on('connected', () => {
  // Makes the code a bit clearer
  const runCommand = x => drone.runCommand(x);

  runCommand(takeoff);

  setTimeout(runCommand, 2000, backFlip);
  setTimeout(runCommand, 4000, landing);
  setTimeout(process.exit, 5000);
});
```
